body_html:
"python -m tensorflow.tensorboard ... "is not useful in the new version
the version I use :
tensorflow & tensorboard : 1.8.0
platform :
windows 10

I found an amazing way to solve this issue

  1. backup the tensorboard.exe
  2. open tensorboard.exe with 010 Editor,I use this
  3. search "python.exe"
  4. change all the ascil code between #! and python.exe to 20(whitespace)
  5. change the quotation marks after python.exe to whitespace

In my computer:
before:
#!"c:\program files\python35\python.exe"
after:
#!　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　python.exe

"python -m tensorflow.tensorboard ... "is not useful in the new version
the version I use :
tensorflow & tensorboard : 1.8.0
platform :
windows 10
I found an amazing way to solve this issue

backup the tensorboard.exe
open tensorboard.exe with 010 Editor,I use this
search "python.exe"
change all the ascil code between #! and python.exe to 20(whitespace)
change the quotation marks after python.exe to whitespace

In my computer:

#!　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　python.exe
body:
"`python -m tensorflow.tensorboard ...` "is not useful in the new version
the version I use :
`tensorflow & tensorboard : 1.8.0`
platform :
`windows 10`

I found an [amazing way](http://enjoytools.net/xe/board_PZRP31/4816) to solve this issue

1. backup the tensorboard.exe
1. open tensorboard.exe with 010 Editor,I use [this](https://wxmedit.github.io/)
1. search "python.exe"
1. change all the ascil code between `#!` and `python.exe` to 20(whitespace)
1. change the quotation marks after python.exe to whitespace

In my computer:
before:
`#!"c:\program files\python35\python.exe"`
after:
`#!　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　python.exe`
